snippet: Many of India’s airlines are rife with safety violations, including shortages of pilots and engines, according to an unreleased report by the industry’s top regulator.
abstract: Many of India’s airlines are rife with safety violations, including shortages of pilots and engines, according to an unreleased report by the industry’s top regulator; analysts say the country's airline industry is nearing a crisis after rapid growth.
lead_paragraph: Many of India’s airlines are rife with safety violations, including shortages of pilots and engines, according to an unreleased report by the industry’s top regulator.

headline.main: Indian Regulator Cites Safety Violations and Financial Ills of Airlines
headline.print_headline: Indian Regulator Cites Safety Violations and Financial Ills of Airlines
